The A320 pilot reported seeing a white quadcopter drone "flash past" the aircraft while travelling south of Brookmans Park last August. The controller said another aircraft had just crossed above but confirmed no other commercial traffic was present, leading to the strong suspicion it was a drone. Such near-misses highlight the urgent need for better detection and greater public awareness to prevent future hazards and ensure aviation safety.

The ILM attributed the low uptake to "ingrained" attitudes among employers, coupled with significant financial worries among new fathers who felt they simply could not afford to take time off.

However, the ILM's findings cast a shadow over these reforms. The institute explicitly stated that its research strongly suggests these legislative changes will have minimal impact on fathers' leave patterns unless the prevailing attitudes of employers are fundamentally addressed and shifted. Without a cultural change, the new provisions may remain largely unused.

Matthew Eteson is on trial at Preston Crown Court for the manslaughter by gross negligence of Kelly Webster, 36, and Lauren Thornton. The family had gone to the Lake District for the Easter bank holiday weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday. But on the afternoon of 1 April, Mr Eteson removed the generator from the deck and used it to power a 1kW fan heater to heat the sleeping quarter, prosecutor Jacob Dyer, told the court. He alleged this action led to a lethal build-up of carbon monoxide in the boat's cabin. Kelly Webster and her daughter, Lauren, were found unresponsive the next morning, having succumbed to the fumes. The prosecution argues Mr Eteson showed "flagrant disregard" for safety, failing in his duty of care. The trial continues, with expert testimony on generator use and boat safety anticipated.

NHS Blood and Transplant (NHSBT) said blood group O negative was vital, as it could be used for patients with other blood groups in an emergency. It said O negative blood made up 12% of transfers, although only 7% of people in the UK had that blood type. Meanwhile, B negative blood is needed for ethnic groups. The NHSBT said ethnic minority groups, who were more likely to have B negative blood, were more prone to sickle cell anaemia, where misshapen blood cells could block blood vessels, causing an early death. It also said that these specific blood types, especially B negative and Ro, are more prevalent in people of Black heritage. This makes donations from these communities incredibly important to provide the best treatment for sickle cell patients, who often need regular transfusions. NHSBT is urgently appealing for more Black and minority ethnic donors to ensure a compatible and sufficient blood supply for all, highlighting the life-saving impact of their donations.

The new charity will manage the National Heritage Collection, which includes Stonehenge and Dover Castle. The government currently contributes £22m annually towards the collection. In particular, police tended to neglect cases where suspects did not use violence but tried to control their victim in other ways such as by making threats. The report said: This oversight puts vulnerable individuals at continued risk, as non-physical control can be just as devastating and often escalates. The pilot scheme aims to address these critical gaps, improving officer understanding and response to the full spectrum of domestic abuse, ensuring victims receive appropriate protection regardless of the nature of the abuse. This initiative highlights the ongoing need for police training to reflect the evolving legal landscape and understanding of complex domestic abuse patterns, ultimately safeguarding more victims.

But a reinterpretation of the law will now allow "collective self-defence" - using force to defend allies under attack. This controversial move, a profound shift in Japan's post-war defence policy, continues to spark intense public debate.
